intro: Raphionacme dinteri, commonly known as the Dinter's raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
